Sequence Information.Peptide Name: Brevini-Eu (natural AMPs; frog, amphibians, animals; UCLL1a)

Literature Information.Literature: APD analysis reveals this sequence is most similar (87.5%) toBrevinin-1EbActivity: Active against Gram- E. coli (MIC 8 ug/ml), K. pneumoniae PTCC1388 (MIC 14 ug/ml), B. cereus PTCC1247 (MIC 12 ug/ml), and S. aureus PTCC1431 (MIC 17 ug/ml).Toxicity: little hemo.lytic (1.9%) at 500 ug/ml.The original entry has been merged with AP2992. Updated 7/2021
Literature Information.Author: Asoodeh A, Sepahi S, Ghorani-Azam A.2014
Literature Information.Reference: Chem Biol Drug Des. 2014 Apr;83(4):411-7. doi: 10.1111/cbdd.12256.PubMed
Literature Information.Title: Purification and modeling amphipathic alpha helical antimicrobial peptides from skin secretions of Euphlyctis cyanophlyctis
